intro: Antidesma venenosum, commonly known as the poison antidesma, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands, often growing in coastal or lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its sap contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation or more severe reactions upon contact. Due to its poisonous nature, it is often avoided in horticultural practices.
